Any products or services put forward appear in no particular order. if you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation. Trends come and go. But white sneakers? They’re forever. Having remained a constant figure in a guy’s rotation for as long as I can remember, the best white sneakers for men are an indispensable part of any well-rounded wardrobe. And for good reason. Easy to style, versatile, and as comfortable as they come, the clean-cut hero is able to freshen up any ensemble with its beautiful, box-fresh glow. Better yet, it’s available in a wide range of designs—from leather to canvas and suede—so you can always find an option suitable for your style. To help you get straight to the good stuff, I’ve handpicked eight of the finest designs, from the very best sneaker brands, that’ll quickly become a mainstay in your collection. Whether you’re wearing jeans or rocking a suit, each offers a fail-safe choice for a plethora of occasions. Key Takeaways I’m not joking: white sneakers are the perfect footwear choice for just about any look. Be it a colorful concoction or an all-black fit, the ultimate all-rounder will bring a sense of freshness to all kinds of ensembles. Which is why I’ve made it my mission to find the very best white sneakers for men. I pored over countless sites and read hundreds of customer reviews to find the best of the best. From Axel Arigato’s Clean 90 design to the ever-impressive Stan Smith, these are the essential styles every guy should consider. And if you’re wondering what makes the perfect white sneaker, I’ve covered that here too. Crafted in Italy with meticulous attention to detail, these sneakers feature premium Italian calfskin leather and durable Margom outsoles. Their sleek, minimalist design exudes elegance, making them a versatile addition to any outfit, from casual jeans to tailored trousers. How To Wear It: These sneakers are perfect for everyday wear, easily transitioning from a casual brunch to an evening out. offer a comfortable fit, essential for day-long wear. The quality leather molds to the shape of your foot over time, enhancing comfort. The Low 1’s The crisp white color makes them a great match with a wide range of colors and styles. To maintain their pristine look, regular cleaning, and proper care are recommended, especially considering the premium leather finish. They’re ideal for those who appreciate a blend of comfort, style, and quality in their footwear. Who Is This For? These sneakers are tailored for the fashion-conscious individual who values quality craftsmanship and timeless design. They’re ideal for those seeking a refined, versatile shoe that complements a variety of looks, from casual to semi-formal. Flaws But Not Dealbreakers: One notable consideration is the sizing. These sneakers tend to run small, so opting for a size up, especially for those who are between sizes, is a safe bet. Additionally, the premium white leather requires regular maintenance to keep the sneakers looking their best. Beat-up white sneakers are definitely a fashion choice, but if you’re looking for long-lasting, fresh-out-of-the-box sneakers, be prepared to spend some time cleaning them. You’ll love the elegant finishing touches like the embossed rubber pebbles at the back and the branded dust bags that they arrive with. Who is this for? Lovers of luxury, rejoice. Tod’s sneakers are going to be a hit with those who like the finer things in life. They’re also great for anyone who’s looking for a smart sneaker that can replace some of your smart-casual shoes. Flaws but not dealbreakers: They don’t come cheap, so you’ll need to be working with a fairly large budget to add these to your collection. However, if you can manage to get the cash together, they’ll certainly prove their worth over time. Particularly suited to relaxed ensembles, they’ll soon become your go-to footwear choice—whether you’re exploring the city or keeping it casual at work. My favorite feature is the 100% vegan insoles that are made from organic mamona oil (a plant-based alternative to petroleum) and cork (which just happens to be extremely comfortable). On top, take your pick from crew neck tees, sweaters, and polo shirts. Who is this for? If you like to prioritize comfort and wearability over current trends, Cariuma’s OCA Low is going to tick a lot of boxes. They’re also the kind of sneakers that will look just as good once they’ve taken a bit of a beating. You can dress it up or down and it’s durable (and stylish) enough to turn to season after season. Revered for their sleek, all-white design, these shoes are a testament to Adidas’s enduring legacy in footwear fashion. Crafted with premium materials, they offer a comfortable fit, making them suitable for all-day wear, whether you’re navigating city streets or enjoying a casual outing. How to wear it: What sets the All White Gazelle apart is its understated elegance. These shoes are more than just a trendy option, they’re also a versatile wardrobe staple. Comfortable, versatile, and effortlessly stylish, you’ll be wearing them to dates, dinners, and drinks at the bar. Whether you’re a sneakerhead or just a guy who likes decent shoes, you’re going to love these. They’re perfect for men who are willing to pay a little extra for real quality. Sizes Available: 7-14.5 | Material: 100% Leather davidcykim / Instagram A Brief History Of Men’s White Sneakers It may have changed the way men dress for good, but the story of how the humble white tennis shoe took over the world and became essential for anything but sport is not one that occurred overnight. Despite relatively new entries to the market from Common Projects (2004), Alexander McQueen (2012), and Tom Ford (2014) — who previously swore he would never make sneakers — the beginnings of the trend can be traced back through menswear for more than 80 years. The original Stan Smiths, worn by the man himself One of the earliest examples of an athletic sneaker to cross over into the mainstream was the white Converse Chuck Taylor, which debuted at the 1936 Berlin Olympics. In the years and decades that followed, crisp white sneakers from brands like Spring Court, Adidas, and Superga found themselves on many a famous foot, Steve McQueen’s included. Fashion types went crazy when, in recent years, Savile Row tailors started styling their suits with white sneakers, but John Lennon was doing it on the cover of Abbey Road back in 1969. Of course, like any other area of menswear, sneaker trends come and go. And though minimalist trainers — typified by models like the Achilles Low and Stan Smith — have reigned supreme since the turn of the millennium, in recent seasons the trend has broadened to include both chunky styles and retro sneakers, rendered in a range of materials from luxury Italian leather to run-of-the-mill mesh. However, they all remain linked by their ability to symbolize off-duty cool in a way few menswear pieces have managed to achieve. Buying Considerations for the Best White Sneakers For Men  Style When it comes to picking a style of white sneakers, consider two things: versatility and occasion. Think about where you’ll be wearing the sneakers most frequently and if they’re suitable for those events. If it’s for casual outings, a sporty design might be best, while formal occasions require something more sleek and refined. Material You should always pay close attention to the materials used to make sneakers. Quality materials not only affect the overall look but also impact durability and comfort. Leather, canvas, and synthetic materials are common for white sneakers. Generally speaking, leather is the best—offering the perfect blend of comfort and durability. Maintenance Before committing to a particular style, it’s a good idea to think about how easy they are to clean should you get them dirty. While there are many cleaning products available for all types of sneakers, some are easier to clean than others. For example, smooth leather sneakers can be easily wiped clean, while textured suede or canvas designs require a more complicated cleaning process. o_____ing / Instagram Why You Should Trust Us Not only am I a self-confessed sneaker addict, I’ve been writing about men’s clothing and shoes for over a decade. During that time, I’ve managed to grasp a deep understanding of what makes a great product. Using this knowledge and some help from online reviewers, I have pulled together eight of the best white men’s sneakers (having started with a list longer than the New York Yankees’ trophy cabinet). Axel Arigato’s Clean 90 remains one of my favorite recommendation. They’ll last, always look fresh (if you look after them), and strike the perfect balance between form and function. A Brief History Of Men’s White Sneakers

It may have changed the way men dress for good, but the story of how the humble white tennis shoe took over the world and became essential for anything but sport is not one that occurred overnight.

Despite relatively new entries to the market from Common Projects (2004), Alexander McQueen (2012), and Tom Ford (2014) — who previously swore he would never make sneakers — the beginnings of the trend can be traced back through menswear for more than 80 years.

One of the earliest examples of an athletic sneaker to cross over into the mainstream was the white Converse Chuck Taylor, which debuted at the 1936 Berlin Olympics. In the years and decades that followed, crisp white sneakers from brands like Spring Court, Adidas, and Superga found themselves on many a famous foot, Steve McQueen’s included. Fashion types went crazy when, in recent years, Savile Row tailors started styling their suits with white sneakers, but John Lennon was doing it on the cover of Abbey Road back in 1969.

Of course, like any other area of menswear, sneaker trends come and go. And though minimalist trainers — typified by models like the Achilles Low and Stan Smith — have reigned supreme since the turn of the millennium, in recent seasons the trend has broadened to include both chunky styles and retro sneakers, rendered in a range of materials from luxury Italian leather to run-of-the-mill mesh. However, they all remain linked by their ability to symbolize off-duty cool in a way few menswear pieces have managed to achieve.

Buying Considerations for the Best White Sneakers For Men 

Style

When it comes to picking a style of white sneakers, consider two things: versatility and occasion. Think about where you’ll be wearing the sneakers most frequently and if they’re suitable for those events. If it’s for casual outings, a sporty design might be best, while formal occasions require something more sleek and refined.

Material

You should always pay close attention to the materials used to make sneakers. Quality materials not only affect the overall look but also impact durability and comfort. Leather, canvas, and synthetic materials are common for white sneakers. Generally speaking, leather is the best—offering the perfect blend of comfort and durability.

Maintenance

Before committing to a particular style, it’s a good idea to think about how easy they are to clean should you get them dirty. While there are many cleaning products available for all types of sneakers, some are easier to clean than others. For example, smooth leather sneakers can be easily wiped clean, while textured suede or canvas designs require a more complicated cleaning process.
